minesweeper.gui

Class ScoreChecker

  • java.lang.Object
    • minesweeper.gui.ScoreChecker

  • public class ScoreChecker
extends Object
    This class manages both ScoreSaver and ScoreKeeper. Also used to evaluate the new score and place it into a proper slot in the score map. Whenever game mode is changed it should be changed in this class too
    Author:
    juri

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ScoreChecker(ScoreKeeper scoreKeeper, GameGui gui, FileContainer fileContainer)
      Sets the difficulty to easy when created.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void evaluateScore(String time)
      Evaluates the score and calls other methods to save the score.
      void resetDifficulties()
      This method is used by the difficulty setters to make sure that only one boolean value in the difficulty array is set to true.
      void setDifficultyToCustom()
      Sets up the scoreChecker for custom game mode.
      void setDifficultyToEasy()
      Sets up the scoreChecker for the easy difficulty mode.
      void setDifficultyToHard()
      Sets up the scoreChecker for the hard difficulty mode.
      void setDifficultyToMedium()
      Sets up the scoreChecker for the medium difficulty mode.

      • resetDifficulties

        public void resetDifficulties()
        This method is used by the difficulty setters to make sure that only one boolean value in the difficulty array is set to true.

      • evaluateScore

        public void evaluateScore(String time)
        Evaluates the score and calls other methods to save the score. Does nothing if the current game mode is set to custom.
        Parameters:
        time - String
